nodes.description: 圣彼得堡地铁发生爆炸事件，造成至少9人死亡、20人受伤，涉事列车在Sennaya Ploshchad与Tekhnologichesky Institut站之间
nodes.support_text: Explosions in two train carriages at metro stations in St. Petersburg Reuters

nodes.description: 俄罗斯总统普京启动调查，初步判定爆炸可能为恐怖袭击
nodes.support_text: Russian President Vladimir Putin said investigators are looking into whether the explosion was a terror attack

nodes.description: 英国外交大臣鲍里斯·约翰逊表示震惊，并向受害者及家属致哀
nodes.support_text: Leading the tributes, British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said he was 'horrified' by the explosion

nodes.description: 德国外长西格玛·加布里埃尔称事件为针对无辜者的卑劣袭击，表达哀悼
nodes.support_text: His German counterpart, Sigmar Gabriel, said he felt 'deep sorrow' when he learned of the attack

nodes.description: 法国外长让-马克·艾吕雅尔宣布与俄罗斯站在一起
nodes.support_text: French Foreign Minister Jean-Marc Ayrault said his country stood in solidarity with Russia

nodes.description: 马耳他总理约瑟夫·穆斯卡特对事件表示哀悼
nodes.support_text: Prime Minister of Malta Joseph Muscat said he felt 'deep sorrow' when he learned of the attack

nodes.description: 意大利外长安吉洛·阿尔法诺呼吁国际社会团结打击恐怖主义
nodes.support_text: Italian Foreign Minister Angelino Alfano said the world had to continue 'to unite to fight against terror'

nodes.description: 奥地利外长塞巴斯蒂安·库尔茨重申需团结应对恐怖主义
nodes.support_text: Austria's Foreign Minister Sebastian Kurz said 'we must close ranks in countering terrorism'

nodes.description: 欧盟委员会副主席费德丽卡·莫盖里尼通过社交媒体向俄罗斯民众致哀
nodes.support_text: Federica Mogherini tweeted: 'Our thoughts are with all people of #Russia'

nodes.description: 北约秘书长延斯·斯托尔滕贝格向事件受害者及俄民众表达深切哀悼
nodes.support_text: Secretary General of NATO Jens Stolenberg said 'Deepest sympathy to those affected by the #StPetersburg metro explosion'

nodes.description: 比利时副首相兼外长迪迪埃·雷伊ндерс向受害者家属致歉
nodes.support_text: Belgium’s Deputy Prime Minister Didier Reynders tweeted: 'My sincere condolences to the families of the victims'

edges.support_text: Russian President Vladimir Putin said investigators are looking into whether the explosion was a terror attack
Leading the tributes, British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said he was 'horrified' by the explosion
His German counterpart, Sigmar Gabriel, said he felt 'deep sorrow' when he learned of the attack
French Foreign Minister Jean-Marc Ayrault said his country stood in solidarity with Russia
Prime Minister of Malta Joseph Muscat said he felt 'deep sorrow' when he learned of the attack
Italian Foreign Minister Angelino Alfano said the world had to continue 'to unite to fight against terror'
Austria's Foreign Minister Sebastian Kurz said 'we must close ranks in countering terrorism'
Federica Mogherini tweeted: 'Our thoughts are with all people of #Russia'
Secretary General of NATO Jens Stolenberg said 'Deepest sympathy to those affected by the #StPetersburg metro explosion'
Belgium’s Deputy Prime Minister Didier Reynders tweeted: 'My sincere condolences to the families of the victims'
